Reviews.Title: Great point&shoot;
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "2PC1Printer"
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera for an upcoming trip. Wanted a point and shoot that was pocket sized and took good pictures. I was going to get a Canon Powershot but then started looking at Panasonic. I feel like I got more for my money. Maybe because Panasonic is not yet a household name in cameras. A few clicks online will reveal they are "joined at the hips" with Leica.Using the iA mode delivered great pictures everytime. Did not take a bad picture yet, the smarts built-in really work! Focusing time is short, but you have to let the camera focus before pressing all the way. Zoom is great for such a small package, but image stabilization is a must without tripod. Also has wide angle lens which is a plus, not readily available in competing models. Have not played with any of the scene modes, I let iA handle that. And when I'll need the manual modes, I'll be reaching for the dSLR where I can play with buttons.Played briefly with the video mode and was happily surprised. It is not a camcorder replacement, but it is better than expected. Sreen is large and bright under all experienced conditions so far. It does have a mode that adjusts LCD brightness to ambient light automatically. I do miss the viewfinder but I would trade a bigger LCD for a poor viewfinder anytime. Great point and shoot camera so far, good optics, it does what it should. Will probably look for a second battery soon, but I am a little confused at moment on which one to buy.

Reviews.Title: HOLY SMOKES!! THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Mountainman
Reviews.Content: First off. I'm not a professional photographer. I'm an average joe that loves to take pictures.Before I left on my trip to Jackson Hole Wyoming I knew I wanted a point and shoot camera. So, being a Nikon man, I looked at the Coolpix but when I started reading all of the great reviews on the FH20, I decided to give it a shot. The battery life, the 8x optical zoom, intelligent auto, 14 megapixel all make this camera remarkable. But it's the ease of use (I never opened the manual) and the fact that there is abosolutely no shutter delay.I shot with this camera 10 to 12 hours per day and still had juice left at the end of the day. To give it to you in a nutshell.This little camera that I carried around in the front pocket of my trek pants for 6 days, packs one hellava wallup!!!...Panasonic has done it!! And the FH20 is by far top of the line in point and shoot. I'm completely sold. Get this camera and I promise you will come back here and rave about it!! I just wish that I could somehow attach a couple of pics that I shot with this camera so as to show you just how stunning your pics will be.

Reviews.Title: Moderately Satisfied
Reviews.Author: WayfarerK
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of good things about this litte camera.1. It's little. I purchased this for a hiking trip to California, so I needed it to be easily stowable. It is.2. Ease of use. My previous camera was a Cannon, and I did not find there was any learning curve in adapting to a different menu set-up.  I love the quick menu- it is incredibly convenient.3. Ability to switch between file sizes easily. All on the quick menu.4. Very good picture quality. I've been spoiled by Cannon, but Panasonic did OK.My biggest complaint: the zoom.  I wanted to upgrade my zoom from the 4x I had on my Cannon to something with a little more...Ooomph.  I figured the 8x would be great.  Except for the fact that this camera can't seem to be able to focus between 3x and 6x.  If I'm set to one extreme or the other (either zoomed all the way back or all the way in), it's fine.  But as I zoom in the camera can't seem to find a spot to focus on.  I've tried pushing down the button slightly, getting the zoom box and trying to show the camera where I wanted it to focus on, but that doesn't work either. I've tried other cameras with high zoom and have not run into the same issue.  As the camera zooms, the focus stays true.  The FH20 starts off focused, gets blurry, and then focuses again.  Pretty disappointing performance when you're trying to shoot landscapes, and everything seems to be in that middle range.All in all this camera was an OK purchase. I like the burst shooting and the video recording, although I think it would have been better to add the video feature to the quick menu.

Reviews.Title: Only just the best compact camera on the market for me
Reviews.Author: Doris C. Moran "Lthousegal"
Reviews.Content: I've used a Canon for many years, recently bought the ultra compact Canon SP790IS.  My original Canon was slowly giving out.  Did research and checked out the FH1,FH3, FP8 and the FH20 along with the Canon 790. Received this camera several days ago, this FH20 rocks. Pictures are really very, very good.  I couldn't believe it.  The size is great, ease of use is beyond belief.  I'm an artist and use my camera to take pictures of lighthouses, old barns and interesting buildings.  This camera gives me what I'm looking for and more.  So glad I took the plunge. As the first reviewer said she read a test of the FH20 by a pro photograher, I read the same article and it's all GOOD. I'd receommend this camera above all others.  Thanks Amazon, once again you came through for me as did Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for a "point and shoot"!
Reviews.Author: George M. Allen
Reviews.Content: Ordered the camera and did not realize it did not come with a memory card.  No big deal as it has 40mb of built in memory.  Took it for a weekend trip to Dumont Dunes.  It took 8 photos (at max resolution) and I simply loaded them on my MacBook, deleted, and took more.  Great pictures, fair video (with limited memory we had to take short ones)but overall a great little camera.  The "automatic mode" makes using it a snap.  A great value, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Lives up to the reviews
Reviews.Author: PMunroe "pmunroe2"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera and took it to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter in Orlando.  My daughter took hundreds of photos in the castle, which was nothing but low light situations.  She also took hundreds of the village in the evening.  Again, low light.  I can count on one hand the pictures that didn't work out, and those happened solely with attempts to photograph 3D holograms.  Everything else came out perfectly.I bought an extra battery to be safe and it wasn't necessary - one battery took us easily through a full day of picture taking.The camera is idiot proof: put it on intelligent auto, point and shoot, and you will get gorgeous photos.  At this price, this camera is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Line Dancing Mom
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome little camera.  Little only in size.  I have been a loyal Canon owner, and have several point and shoots as well as a Rebel D SLR.  I wanted a new camera for a wedding and graduations and this camera caught my eye..mainly because it was red.This zoom is amazing, the scene modes give the user many options, from beach to snow.  The low light option  was what I really wanted since I have not found any P and S camera that can handle low light situations.  This camera can!!  No lie. The pictures are crisp and clear.I love the ease of the functions, I think this camera is "goof proof".  Very user friendly without sacrificing the high end features.I bought an extra battery, and a faster level 4 SD card which does make a difference with start up and rapid photography.Enjoy this camera!!

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: I am a pro in photography for more than a decade. Although I mainly shoot with Slr, I do own few compact cameras handy when I am not too serious about getting that perfect shoot. Of all small cameras that I own, this one is the only one that didn't disappoint me. Most other digtal cameras have few problem such as high iso noise, low image quaility, loud zooming sound, too big, start up too slow and etc.This one is perfect: Start up is fast & quite; image quailty is great (see photos I have uploaded); HD video quailty is great; control is simple; lens is best (it is sharp and does 8x optical zoom); outside looks great, fashionable, stylistic, price is cheap. In short, this fh20 is a great camera.This camera can deliver dslr like image quailty, but only if you know what you are doing. As a pro in photograph, I saw a lot of photo getting bad image using high-end dslr, so photography is a skill and art, and a camera is merely a tool. For me, this is a great tool. Although it lacks controls such as changing the aperture or shutter speed manually, you can still get great result if you know how this camera react to different situation such as lighting in a particularly enviromental. It is more than pressing the shutter release to take a picture; Photograhy is all about lighting. A camera that can take Hd video is great. Still the same point, it can record clear sharp video in a controlled eniroment. Don't expect to take great video in a sunny day where the harsh light shining everywhere.I got a 8gb class 4 sd card for $15 that works fawlessly and a great deal. I can record about 10min of HD video because max. file side per-file is 2 gb, so a 8gb card can record 40 mins of HD video. And 8gb can take 1600+ highest 14 mp photos. I use photoshop and premiere pro to edit my photo and video.== update after some use ==-Still some lagging, about 1.5 second for start up(the lens needs that time to come out), about 6 seconds for 8X zoom.-Image quality drops dramatically from ISO 200-1600; ISO100 is a acceptable, but I will stay in ISO 80 all the time if possible.-This camera is no good for light low photography.-Changing the modes is a little painful because I change modes very often. It is complicated compared to a simple switch. Simplicity is very important experience.-It is not easy to change the ISO which is something that I do very often as well.-100% correct light metering hasn't invented yet, but the light meter of this camera tends to over-exposed for about 1Ev in movie mode, so I alway use -1 Ev compensation for movie, but in picture mode, I need to adjust compensation according to the scene.-There is no auto-focus in movie mode.-Just got a third battery 1000mah battery cheaply from ebay. Battery indicator is still full after one day of use. If you buy this camera, I would highly recommend that you get this battery as well.-Finally, just a little personal thought, it is a little gay for a guy to have this red tiny camera. If all of your friends owns some big black camera with a huge lens, and you are using this comparatively small red camera, you will be looking a little small and gay when shooting pictures with them. It is totally like the scenario of having a small pistol or a big shotgun in the field.Still a 5 stars pistol.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera - from an experienced photographer
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I've used both Nikon and Canon SLRs and P&S; cameras for years, but was looking to replace my little Canon P&S; with something that stores larger files, has better zoom, good quality, ease of operation, decent batter life, and reasonable cost. I am absolutely blown away by this camera. The image stabilization is phenomenal, the macro works beautifully, the color renditions are superb, and I was delighted to learn that I could actually INCREASE the optical zoom capability by reducing the picture file size. What a wonderful idea.I took movies and photos of a Penn State womens' volleyball game from nearly the top of the stand at PSU's Rec Hall (perhaps 100 feet from the action) and they (team and photos) are outstanding. The movies are clear and stable, while the photos with the sports preset (no flash, of course) are amazing, considering the distance and level of zoom I was using. The automatic ISO setting work great - unlike Nikon and Canon. We tried the sunset photos last night and they are sharp as a tack with great color and very little grain. Portraits are as good as my SLR, and the exposures are spot on. The controls are amazingly user friendly for a camera with so many options. This is one well thought-out piece of equipment.The test, in my opinion, is how the photographs print. So far I have printed ten 8x10s - half of them are scenes, one quarter are portraits, and one quarter are still life (some done with zoom macro). They are outstanding. I would have no hesitation framing them and submitting for judging in an art show.A downside I see to this camera is that it doesn't look like a serious camera. Make it bigger, heavier, and more expensive and it will still sell like hotcakes. The other downside is that the photo handling software included with the camera is practically useless. The only thing I can find that's useful is the fairly complete properties information, though some is missing. Jeez, Panasonic, you would think you could do good software with such a great camera.The FH20 is the first Panasonic camera I have ever owned, but I like it so much I bought an ZS-5. That too is a fantastic camera with many more bells and whistles. Way to go Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Worst Customer Support Experience Ever -- Do Not Buy!
Reviews.Author: Michael Poling
Reviews.Content: I suggested this camera to my daughter based upon online reviews.  She was extremely excited about the camera and the pictures looked really good.  She used it twice within the first 6 weeks she had it.  The second time using it, a piece of flimsy plastic that sits in front of the lens fell off.  Panasonic / Lumix had me send it it (on my dime) and I clearly specified that it was not dropped.  I sent it in and received no acknowledgement that they'd received it and / or where it may now be in their process.  After waiting 2 weeks and calling them, they informed me that it was the user's fault and I could receive a broken camera back (I assume they'd return the broken camera on their nickel) or pay $128 to fix a 6 week old, never dropped $160 camera.  I informed them that this is the single worst customer support experience I have ever encountered.  Panasonic / Lumix, as promised....here is your review.  I will never buy another product from you and hopefully I may influence a few others out there.  You had a chance...

Reviews.Title: Good outdoor, but indoor flash photos were not very good
Reviews.Author: Tom Cat "cool GPS"
Reviews.Content: I ended up returning this camera because it had a tendency to push red colors for indoor flash photos.  Perhaps mine was a bad unit - but I'm not sure.  My daughter's hair looked slightly red. Our maple cabinets had a slight redish color only when using the flash.  There was also more grain (noise) in the photos than I would have liked for indoor.  Outdoors this camera did and excellent job.  I wanted to keep it, but I decided on the ZS7 instead (it did not push red color).  This camera could use a little stronger flash as well.

Reviews.Title: AVOID PANASONIC PRODUCTS
Reviews.Author: Natalie Wallace
Reviews.Content: Our camera worked well for a month until it broke.  Working with Panasonic's customer support has been a nightmare.  They refused to honor their warranty and are making excuses as to why they are charging me for a replacement unit.  When I try to escalate to speak to a supervisor, none are available, they promise to call back and weeks pass with no response.Save yourself a headache and buy another brand - I will never buy another product from Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Good but still disappointed
Reviews.Author: kc18
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to the quality of image it produces. I quickly took landscape pictures and some family photos. While taking the family photos I noticed that getting a picture of my one year old was particularly impossible. It looks for smiles and auto focuses but while doing that it takes forever to shoot. There is no way to make it take the picture with just a random push of the button. You always have to hold it and let it focus before it will take a photo. This leaves random in the moment shots of friends and family a bit difficult to obtain.

Reviews.Title: Great Budget Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: bozisuk
Reviews.Content: I shopped around for a digital camera for months. I saw this camera (FH20) on digitalcamera-hq.com where they rated it as the best consumer camera for the year. I figured I might as well look into it a little. I was impressed with the specs, features, and ultimately the price! I bought mine as a used model but in mint condition so it only cost me $131 but it's brand new!As for the actual camera, I LOVE IT! It takes pretty good pictures for a camera in this price range and size. It's shutter lag time is virtually nothing. It takes under a second to focus, and when you press down the shutter button the rest of the way, it takes the photo instantly.It also has a burst mode that takes low quality shots very fast, over one a second, for as long as you want! It's iA or intelligant auto mode seems to somewhat work. It doesn't always pick the right scene so I prefer to just select my scene manually. That way I can be very picky because there are many scenes to choose from. It also has a nice my scene feature where when you press the iA button twice, it goes to your selected mode. The only problem with this is that there is no video mode or picture mode button, so I usually have to use the my scene mode for video or just for normal picture mode. That's kind of annoying!Another nice feature is it's 8x zoom. It zooms in really far and has very good stabalization, so the 8x zoom pictures actually come out clear!The video quality may say HD, but its more like standard definition in a widescreen format, but that's not a surprise since its a point and shoot camera. So far the regular picture quality is very good for the price range. It's outdoor shots and still shots are excellant. Pictures get a tad blury if people are moving or if its getting dark, but that's expected with a point and shoot.Overall, it's a great camera for anyone looking for a inexpensive point and shoot to carry around. I would highly recommend it for this purpose to anyone!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent point-and-shoot camera for less than $200!!
Reviews.Author: NuLook
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent point and shoot camera, I have ever had. I have owned canon point and shoot cameras. Initially I was reluctant buying panasonic camera, considering canon and nikon to be the best players in cameras world. But ever since yesterday, when I got this camera in mail, I am thoroughly enjoying this camera. All pictures taken in dark or day light are awesome. No complaints. I would highly recommend this to anyone buying point and shoot for less than $200.BTW, I also own Nikon DSLR D80 and I wanted a smaller one so it can be taken to the places where you don't want to look like a 'camera-man' :-).

Reviews.Title: Good Camera and good price
Reviews.Author: L. Flaman
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my foreman at work based on Consumer Reports ratings on a similar but discontinued model. Took it out of the box to charge it, put in the SD card and tweak settings, and from what I could tell it seemed fairly user friendly which is good for someone who is almost technologically illiterate (like my boss). Once you've got the picture quality and resolution the way you like it, the auto-intelligent settings pretty much handles itself for you and turns the camera into a point-and-shoot camera in any situation. Viewing/deleting pictures on the camera are also easy, and transferring pictures to a computer is as easy as sticking the SD card into a media card reader.

Reviews.Title: Ultimate Real Estate Professional's Camera
Reviews.Author: Tahl Weaver "Full Septic"
Reviews.Content: The FH20 needs a little tinkering to set up, but, once set up, it is the ultimate ease of use, high quality photo camera for real estate professionals in my experience. I increased the brightness to just over 1, set the photos at 5MP, installed a 2GB high speed SD card, and then set the iA button for Night Portrait. I am a real estate appraiser. My mission is to get through a house as thoroughly and efficiently as possible as well as to snap photos at 30+ mph of homes set back 100' off the road way without holding up traffic and be able to take photos of paint peeling at five stories up... This does it all and does it well.By having the "alternate photo" button on the top of the camera, you can quickly go from point and shoot mode to one style that you set up. In my case, I found the point and shoot great for everything, including 50mph drivebys, but the quick switch over to the alternate photo as Night Portrait and I am taking crystal clear photos of basements, bathrooms, hallways, and, especially, attics WITH NO LIGHTS ON and NO BLUR! The quick click photo review lever allows for a quick look back if the review time on the photo runs out too quickly. I got 400 photos on it after charging the first time and there was room to spare before heading out again. The battery added about 100 photos worth of charge in 20 minutes. The batteries are expensive so I opted for a second camera and I alternate the battery out of the charger with one camera, while I keep the spare camera in the car without a battery (after smashing my camera from slipping on a moss-covered rock). The battery door seemed unfamiliar at first, but the logic behind being able to quickly access the SD card without disrupting the battery is great. My last camera powered off when you accessed the SD card, which was sometimes a pain. The build quality is better IMHO than both four-letter major camera brands that start with S and F. This thing is hot at 14MP and the ability to read SDXC cards in the future.UPDATE 02/13/13: 2-300 photos x 5 days a week for two plus years. Same battery. Same battery life. Same quality. Survived numerous drops. Door to battery and SD card latches fine. No problems. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix 14.1 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara Hudson "Bearded Iris"
Reviews.Content: This takes gorgeous photos.  I usually use a DSLR and multiple lenses, but for convenience, always carry a pocket camera.  In fact, I usually have more than one pocket camera, because spare batteries for them are so expensive that sometimes it's economical to just buy an extra camera.  The battery charger for this camera is the best designed so far, no cords, just a battery receptacle and a plug.  Product description is accurate as to features, so I won't reiterate them here.

Reviews.Title: No longer a fan!
Reviews.Author: The Walkers "Mother of 3"
Reviews.Content: For starters I bought this camera because my Cannon which I paid 300.00 for broke and was rendered useless after just one year. We were taking photos and after our third photo it just turned itself off and never would turn back on. Camera repair place wanted to charge is 250.00 to fix it!! HA! We then bought an Olympus Stylus 7030. It was the WORST camera I have ever owned.(i reviewed it too if you go to my profile and look for the review) After a month we sent it back. Then we bought this camera. We love this camera!!!The pro's:* the size is small but not too small. Fits in my hand just right. Also this camera is in no way bulky.* the shutter speed is GREAT! I am loving not having to wait forever to take multiple shots in a row like Cannon and Olympus cameras.* I chose this model verses the newest one because I didn't need all the many extra modes and I am not a professional or nothing. Just want to take photos of my kids.* The battery lasts us about a week or two with taking many photos a day of the kids. I have taken about 200 photos and have only charged the battery once.* I love the option of multi delete... very convenient when it takes 10 photos in a row to get one good photo of my kids with eyes open and not making a goofy face :)* The shutter speed is GREAT. I is about half the time it took on our Cannon and Olympus models.* Favorite color is red... nuff said on that :)* The weight is perfect. Not to heavy, and not to light.* Flash works great even at long distant shots* I like the placement of the flash, buttons, zoom and all. All easy to navigate.* Very user friendly... still have yet to look at the owners manual* The auto mode is pretty good* I love all the modes... I have played around with alot of them and they are all great at their designed functions. I never had fireworks come out so well in a photograph.The Cons:* The flash is good but there is some room for improvement. Some photos come out a little dark if the object is more than 4 feet away in a very dark room.* Once you are recording a video you cannot zoom in or out. So if you start close to your childs face or something better hope they stay put because you will not be able to zoom out!* The microphone is right next to your face so you sound like a train coming verses the person you are trying to capture.* Panasonic customer service - my camera was sent defective. I contacted Panasonic and they verified through trouble shooting that it was not working properly. So they said I had to send it back and they would repair it. I explained that I had a newborn and Christmas was in three weeks and I did not want to be without a camera more than a few days. They said it could take many weeks!!! When I told them I was not willing to be without a camera for that long especially being Christmas was right around the corner and I didn't want to buy another camera just to get my kids Christmas photos and pictures of our babies precious newborn period they told me that they could not help me out. I even spoke to a manager! He actually laughed when I told him I would not buy another Panasonic product! I then called Amazon... they mailed me a brand new camera and package to send the broken one back. THANK YOU AMAZON, SHAME ON YOU PANASONIC CUSTOMER CARE! If the camera was not so awesome I would sent it back and keep searching for a good camera.. but I really really like this camera!UPDATE 6/2011After owning this camera for many many months now I have more cons that pros.The Cons:1. the biggest con is the customer service... after sitting on hold for 30 minutes they quickly tell you that they will not or cannot help you. They are also very rude and short.2. The year warranty is only for interior components, so if you drop your camera or crack the lense, or break the batter/SD card cover off (which I did)then it is not covered!3. The battery/SD card cover is nothing but a thin slice of plastic that with very little pressure will break right off. Due to the way it was built there is not way in H*** you can fix this. You will not have the tool or parts to even attempt.4. Auto mode is great until you see the pictures blow up to a 4x6 or bigger. They are all fuzzy. I have used auto/intelligent mode a million times over the last 9 months and it never got it right. It would be night and in our dark bedroom without any lights but the TV on and it would not use the flash, or it would use the flash during the day in direct sunlight, or if anyone even slightly moved it would blur them right out.5. There is no function on your photo viewing on the camera to edit the photos in any way like my old cannon, such as removing red eye and such. This wasn't a huge deal until I bought my little portable printer for photos... I no longer need upload the photos on my computer so I am no longer fixing red eyes there.6. The battery life only gets shorter as the months go by.7. lastly... I REALLY REALLY HATE THE CUSTOMER SERVICE!UPDATE UPDATE 9/23/11The camera just stopped focusing today! What gives? It just turns on and then tries and tries to focus then tells me to turn it off. Instead of even trying to call customer service I did one better... I took the camera that I have owned less than a year and threw it in the trash! Bought a Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-HX100V and OMGosh... if you want a point and shoot with the amazing ability if you so choose as a professional camera then check it out. I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE it! I can't get over how much I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: octopus
Reviews.Content: NO REGRETS with buying this Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 14.1 MP. There are so many cameras out there and so many brands that it's hard to work out which one to go with. This is one is light. It charges up quickly. Easy to figure out - has lots of features and takes GREAT photos - no regrets and very happy with the purchase. Highly recommend the camera - for the price you would be getting a great quality product.

Reviews.Title: What a bargain
Reviews.Author: Sondra S. Dilorenzo "texmamaw"
Reviews.Content: Extremely pleased with this camera.  Really good photos, quick response time on the flash.It's lightweight, fits in my pocket, and it's a pretty red, too.  I highly recommend this camera for the tourist or casual photographer.Great to have handy when out with your grandchildren.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Jesse Speidel
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my Wife's birthday. Her two major complaints with her previous compact point and shoot digital camera were; the delay time between pushing the button and the camera actually taking the picture, and the delay time between shots. This camera does not have those issues. It is all we hoped for and more.

Reviews.Title: super point and shoot
Reviews.Author: PeterZ "PeterZ"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a gift for my daughter.  It takes great photos and is easy to use.  I purchased thru Amazon with the gift wrap option and it came exactly on time. Very happy with Amazon.  This camera has a user friendly menu,- nice lcd screen that is very clear and bright.  So far we have no complaints of any sort.  It is obviously not the most expensive camera but for its price it does the job of taking quicky photos well. She has some nice macro shots of water drops on flowers, pictures of her dog in black and white mode, small video recording and of course pics of Mom and Dad. They are all pretty good shots- I tip my hat as I have a 10 mp dslr and it is often hard to get easily the quality pics that she got with minimal knowledge and experience with this camera.  She had an old Fuji F10 that this camera replaced- it has been replaced fully.  I would recomend this camera.

Reviews.Title: great little camera with lots of nice functions!
Reviews.Author: wooly bear
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, light in the hands, and does great closeup shots. We use it for medical/surgical shots with bad lighting and lots of reflected mess and it does a great job!

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: I have had several cameras in the past. I take a lot of pictures of my dogs and have never been able to get clear pictures of them before. I read the reviews on this camera and decided to give it a try. I have to say it is AWESOME! Very easy to use, charged the battery and started snapping pictures. The pet setting is great! Before I always had red eye, or closed eyes because of the flash. And of course they would always move so the picture would be blurry. With the Panasonic Lumix on pet setting there is no bright flash, so my dogs don't close their eyes, and no red eye. And when you click, that is the picture you get. With all my other cameras I would take a hundred pictures and maybe get 2 or 3 good ones out of it. With the Lumix I have taken at least a hundred pictures and so far only 1 blurry one, and that was my fault. Did I say I LOVE this camera?

Reviews.Title: Easy use with options for experts
Reviews.Author: bibisilva
Reviews.Content: I took this camera with me on a cruise to Egypt and Greece.  Once I found the "easy" button, I was taking great pictures even inside the tombs! Flash free of course.  It is very easy to use and learn.  This was actually the camera we handed to others to take our group/family shorts. There were a couple features that I couldn't figure out on the fly, like the "action" picture setting.  But honeslty, once I got back to my room and read the instructions, I felt sort of silly for not figuring it out. Anyone with a little more camera savvy thay myself I sure could have done it.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC stills, but video is marginal
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very little shutter lag  Performs well in low-light situations  Super macro mode allows you to focus within ONE INCH of subjects  Zoom range is second to noneCons: Any time you video a light or the sun, it has long white lines going from the top to the bottom of the image.  Makes it almost impossible to use the video unless you can avoid shooting any lights.  Even the reflections of the sun on the water makes lines all the way across the image.

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Kaplan
Reviews.Content: Received this camera yesterday.  I have to say it was super simple to set up, the battery charged in just over 90 minutes, and I love the quality of the pictures I've taken so far.  For the money I don't think there is a better camera out there.  I did plenty of research online before buying and found this model to have the highest overall ratings of the point-and-shoot cameras I looked at with similar specs (+10 megapixels, +5X zoom, color options).  It was also competitively priced, Amazon's deal made it even more enticing.  I was not able to find this for a lower price anywhere - online or in brick and mortar stores.I would recommend this to anyone looking for a small camera with decent specs at a great price point.  The color options don't hurt either.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I own an older Lumix and I love it, so when I wanted to buy cameras for my siblings this summer I bought two of these new ones and they were very happily received gifts! For the money this is an excellent camera - it has a super zoom which allows you to photograph things from far away, which will be great for my stepsister taking photos of her horses in the pasture, and it is absolutely tiny, which is great for my brother as he likes to stuff everything (ipod, books, you name it) into the pockets of his cargo pants. It takes wonderful photos and makes it really easy to grab a quick home movie on the fly. The controls are nicely balanced, if you just want to get a snapshot without thinking about it too hard it is easy to use in idiot mode, and if you want to have more input into what your picture looks like there are plenty of serious-photographer options for you to choose from, although there is no manual focus. And it comes in variety of fun colours - I chose a red one for my stepsister and a black one for my brother.Unlike my older Lumix - a DMC TZ3 - this one does not come with a Leica lens, it has an 8x optical zoom rather than a 10x optical zoom, and it is manufactured in China rather than Japan. But then again it costs less than half the price I paid for my old DMC TZ3, and it is about half the size. If you want a Leica-lensed more serious Lumix you can still buy one, they make new models with the Leica lens, loads more options and a price to match - this one, the DMC ZS7 looks pretty awesome Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black). But if you want to get a great camera for a very low price you will be very happy with this one, it is a lot of fun in a small package.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Diane Wagler "Diane"
Reviews.Content: After a couple of months of reading reviews and researching different cameras I ordered the Lumix from Amazon after looking at it in a retail store.  This camera is just what I was looking for.  I liked the controls on this one best and it's very easy to use and small enough to fit in my purse. I have a lot of grandchildren and like the point and shoot feature and can take one picture after another quickly. The pictures are very clear.  I love the red color and it was a great price.  Nothing I dislike about this camera.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: T. Richmond
Reviews.Content: I looked for just the right camera for aleast a month.  Read review after review and chose the panasonic lumix fh20 because of the features and shutter speed.  I did not want to have to wait to take the next picture.  Speed is great and the clarity of the pictures is also great.  There are a few things that would make it better such as smile detect but for the price range it comes loaded with extras. For just the average picture taking of kids, anamials, vacations I think its great.  Color is also pretty neat(got the red)I ordered this on a Friday and got it on Monday.  Did not expect it until Wed.  which was still pretty fast.  Service from Amazon is always great.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy Panasonic products
Reviews.Author: Murf
Reviews.Content: THis camera stopped working properly 6 months after purchase. The error message I got indicated a software problem according to the individual I talked to at the warranty center. I returned the camera and was later notified that it was not covered by the warranty as there was a dent in the corner. The camera was never dropped, or damaged in any way. I am at the mercy of Panasonic, since I didn't take a picture of the camera before sending it in. I am sure that whatever happened, was done soley so they would not have to honor the warranty. I will never buy a panasonic product again.

Reviews.Title: Quality camera
Reviews.Author: tjblanshan
Reviews.Content: This camera stands up to its reviews.  Have been a professional photographer for many years.  Bought this for my wife for those easy and quick shots of our grand kids.  Picture quality and ease of use could not be better.  My wife loves it!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: One Old Punk
Reviews.Content: I got tired of lugging my DSLR everywhere so I did some research and this looked like the camera for me.  I was really surprised at the quality of pictures this little thing puts out.  It has several presets for different lighting conditions, almost more than you would ever need.  But if the need arises, it's there.  It's size is one of it's best selling points besides the quality of photos.  Being a guy, I don't have the luxury of carrying a purse, so this camera fits nicely in my pocket.  My wallet is bigget than this little gizmo.  The battery life is good, but I bought an extra just in case.  I haven't had to change it out while using it yet, so far so good.  To sum it up, this is a great little camera to have as a back-up if you don't want to heft around your DSLR or in social settings.  The quality is there, it's easy to use, and it is tiny. So if that is what you are looking for, look no further, this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC model
Reviews.Author: mmc
Reviews.Content: This camera is terrific. I have always had a problem with Digital cameras that where as it seems to take very long in between clicks from picture to picture.  The shutter speed on this camers is very fast. The lighting adjusts well to any time of day and the autofocus setting is extrodinary as it can focus on many areas of the picture at one time.I am very happy with this camera and the price was great as well.

Reviews.Title: Bought this camera for my wife, but I use it most of the time.
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Enough said. This is a great little point and shoot camera - easy to use - fits in shirt pocket - good (not great) photos - the price is right. If I want great photos I use my DSLR, but it doesn't fit in my shirt pocket!

Reviews.Title: FINALLY found an awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: crazytwins "crazytwins"
Reviews.Content: After tons of searching and reading reviews... finally found an awesome camera! Thanks also to prior reviewers for their great reviews!Had a Fujifilm I loved for years... son broke it... then the hunt for new camera started. Wasn't easy at all. Main thing I was concerned with was great picture quality and the colors to come out well, skin tones. Tried some more expensive cameras out - and just was not impressed.Great picture quality.Good low light shots.Colors are coming out very natural.Pretty easy to use.Love the 8x zoomReally nice fast shooting speed.Size and price.Red eye reduction works well.Good image stablization.Some other cameras I tried out before this and was not impressed were the Fujifilm F70exr (thought the images were grainy)...The Sony DSC-H55 - (excellent pictures - except for my outdoor shots the colors were off and pretty fake/painted looking)Canon SD1300IS - didn't care for anything about the photo quality.The Sony DSC-W350 - was a tough decision between that and this Lumix. Picture quality was identical I felt.  In the long run, decided to keep this Lumix - preferred the 8x zoom (Sony only was 4x), and the shooting speed was much much faster. Would also though highly recommend the DSC-W350 though - both are equally great cameras at a similar price... and that has a nice panoramic feature and is even smaller and lighter.  For me the deciding factor was the faster shooting speed and great zoom the Lumix offered (though really liked that panoramic feature on the Sony!)But I would highly recommend this camera. Great camera for a great price!

Reviews.Title: Very Solid Little Camera
Reviews.Author: D. George "butterball"
Reviews.Content: For the money, I don't think you can beat this little camera. It's easy to use, easy to carry, has a long battery life and takes great pictures. Because of it's size, it can't really be expected to handle long distance pictures very well but the quality of the other pictures is very high, including night shots. For an easy-to-use, all purpose point-and-shoot, I absolutely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Job Panasonic!!
Reviews.Author: Patricia Kimball
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a new digital camera that was small, took great pictures and was very simple to use (for those of us who are digital camera challanged). I had another brand but after a couple years of trying to figure out how it worked, just got disgusted because it was not as user friendly as they had said it was. Another thing I hated about other makes was the fact that they all used the AA batteries. This was a big part of the decision making because those AA batteries only lasted for about 10-20 minutes when put into the camera so was constantly changing them.  So I started researching and reading hundred of reviews. After all was said and done, I went for the Panasonic Lumix FH-20. I got it out of the box and was pleasantly surprised at how compact and small it was and how very definitely these are VERY user friendly. I am so happy I don't have to carry a case of AA batteries with me anymore. The battery in this camera is awesome and lasts forever (well, you do have to charge it). The picutres I've taken so far are crip, sharp and the colors are true. Love the zoom feature too. This little camera really packs a punch..it has many other features that a simple to figure out and use. I'm just a simple person who just wants to aim, snap and go (and get great pics) and this camera has done that for me. You sure hit the nail on the head Panasonic for any digital camera challanged people out there..like me. I love my new little Lumix FH-20. Would recommed this camera to everyone. Oh, and believe me, you won't miss the viewfinder..I always found them annoying anyway. Happy picture taking everyone!

Reviews.Title: This camera ROCKS!
Reviews.Author: Fizzgig
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is the best camera you can get. I am a sculptor of miniature fairies and needed a high-res camera for extreme macro shots. But I only had $180 in my budget. I paid quite a bit less than that for this Lumix. With a little learning curve, I am able to change exposure times, white settings, lighting, focus, etc. I'm getting professional-looking photos and, in my opinion, they are every bit as good as the ones the experts online are using with $3,000 cameras. Not kidding.I am also a landscape pastel painter and am getting incredible nature shots. The colors are true and closeups and wide angle shots are high resolution with little effort. I've also taken family portraits and used the "burst" mode for multiple shots of my pets with great results.It's small and the parts seem well-made. I dropped it on the hardwood floor when my dog went flying by and it still works like a charm. The battery lasts ALMOST as long as my old Kodak EasyShare DX7630 (which has a GREAT battery life and is a GREAT camera and you can buy it cheaply now. It just didn't have quite the res at macro levels I needed).I have not played with the video mode too much, but did get a clearer picture than I expected.There are three things that may deter a potential buyer or the Lumix DMC-FH20: 1. There IS a bit of a learning curve. You have to be willing to play with it for a few hours. 2. The manual is practically useless. Also, there is very little instruction available online. I plan on posting a few instructions based on my experience soon. 3. Without changing the white settings each time, or adjusting the "modes" the photos tend to be a tad too yellow/orange. This is easily solved by adjusting the camera; you just have to figure it out first. Or change the color balance in Photoshop with just a little tweaking.I hope this review helps, and good luck with your photographing endeavors!

Reviews.Title: Where Had I Been?
Reviews.Author: Obi "Obi wan liberali"
Reviews.Content: Keeping up with technology is a challenge for me.  It seems like just yesterday I purchased a 3.2 megapixel camera, and finding to my chagrin that my old Canon 35 mm took better pictures.  So finding it harder and harder to find film and batteries for my old Canon, I decided to check out digitals.  Seeing some reviews of the Panasonic Lumix, I decided to give it a go.  I have been pleasantly surprised at the picture quality, and the ease of use, both taking pictures and downloading them to my computer.  The camera is also small, light and easy to haul around.  I just keep it in my pocket and bring it out and quickly take pictures.  The digital zoom also works really well and can create some interesting effects.  I don't give out a lot of 5 stars to products such as this, but I have been sufficiently impressed with my Lumix to justify the rating.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT CAMERA!!
Reviews.Author: AllyB
Reviews.Content: I am ordering this camera for the second time in less than 30 days. I purchased the camera quickly and without much research as the camera I owned stopped working several days before leaving for my first vacation in 3 years -- a Caribbean cruise. The camera arrived 2 days prior to my leaving so I didn't have much time to read the directions, figure out how to use it, etc. I didn't take it out of the box until I boarded the ship. I just began clicking away. It was extremely easy to use, extremely easy to figure out all the different features, compact enough to fit in my small bag, and it took great pictures. I really did only have to point and shoot! It includes features to enhance your picture if you are taking a beach scene, taking a picture of food, taking a scenery shot, etc., etc. As great as I thought it was, my perfect little red camera couldn't survive being inadvertently dropped in the pool by me at Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville on the island of Grand Turk while I was trying to capture another great vacation moment. Maybe I should have had one less margarita but I felt during that particular week, a few were deserved. I loved the camera so much for that one week that I'm ordering another one. I loved it so much that despite being laid off from my job of 17 years only 16 hours prior to leaving for this recent vacation, and having to now watch every penny while I look for another job, I want to have this camera to capture life's moment's as this next chapter of my book begins. PS: I was able to rescue the memory card and all my pictures were fine and came out great.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Carrie G. Bell
Reviews.Content: Great little camera that goes anywhere.  Zoom is wonderful.  Lightweight and fits easily into pocket or purse.  Video works well too.  Wanted small camera with great zoom and this one is perfect for me.  Love the red color so I can find it inside my purse.  Good job Panasonic!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Rami Margalit
Reviews.Content: I like the look, Quality of picture and ease of use.I did not like the fact that the camera does not jhave DVD q Video capabilities

Reviews.Title: Love it! Great camera and takes beautiful pictures!
Reviews.Author: Baillynn
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! The picture quality is spectacular! I've owned cameras that were twice and three times as much as I paid for this one and this camera still has them beat with it's easy to use features and best of all the excellent picture quality. I was a little reluctant because I haven't heard much about Panasonics digital cameras but so glad that I took the leap and bought one!

Reviews.Title: best small auto camera available
Reviews.Author: alan
Reviews.Content: Just set it on the intelligent mode and shoot.  I will adjust for close up, low light, various focus points, various exposure points, and pretty much takes the best picture possible without setting all the options. Picture quality is very good; battery life good, movie size adequate.  The only things lacking is no zoom with movies, and the camera is hard to hold with one hand and take a picture.  Very good buy and now inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: christian
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera, great photos and zoom, easy to use, this is the best camera that i ever had....recommended

Reviews.Title: Can't ask for more
Reviews.Author: Donald F. Freeman "donaldff"
Reviews.Content: I needed to get a camera for someone who had a Kodak camera whose display had gone bad.  I knew it'd be small, but I couldn't believe how much smaller it is than the Kodak.  The display is extremely sharp, and the camera is very easy to use.  Just a few buttons control everything.  I'd recommend it to anyone, but remember to buy a memory card because the camera itself can only hold about 15 pictures.  Pretty much any card will work, so it comes down to how much you're willing to pay.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: HollyMac
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a replacement to a very nice, expensive Kodak which would not focus, and low light pics were terrible. Researched all point and shoots, and got some great feedback on this one. Took the chance, and so glad I did.  Low light pictures are wonderful! Intelligent Auto does all the work especially when taking vacation pics. Just had my first grandbaby and the pics are so amazingly clear. Great camera! Great price! Easy to use!

Reviews.Title: It's A Trip!
Reviews.Author: Richard Karlin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on reviews and it hasn't disappointed me.  I've used it for stills and for video clips and it's great.  My girlfriend has appropriated the camera for her upcoming trip to europe; she won't have to carry a separate video camera!  We've taken it to the zoo and to an aquarium; great photos and videos from both trips!  Purchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: Breaks very easily, not great quality.
Reviews.Author: A. Gift For You "Kelly"
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why there are such awesome reviews on this camera.  I bought it because of the great reviews but it didn't take great pictures like people are suggesting.  Outside pictures were good but inside the shots were grainy or the flash was too bright.  It also broke when dropped not that far off the floor (my other cameras like the Canon I owned was much more durable.)  For the price it's not bad just don't expect amazing shots like the rest of the reviews.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE!
Reviews.Author: Heather Wilson
Reviews.Content: I did a LOT of research on good point-and-click cameras and I am SO glad that I did.  This camera is absolutely fantastic.  We got it before our daughter was born because we wanted to be able to take easy, quick, quality pictures.  I have been notorious for having awful cameras, but I am now very proud to own this one -- and my friends have commented on its ease of use (even without a view finder, which I never used anyway).  It's such a fabulous camera that my recommendation led to my father-in-law purchasing one (he LOVES it) and to my brothers and I buying it for our technologically-challenged mother (she LOVES it).  The LCD screen is large and makes it easy to see what you're taking a picture of.  The zoom in-zoom out is simple to navigate.  I know you can put the camera on different settings, and I haven't really used many of them, but if you want an EASY camera that is fast and that takes fabulous pictures, this is the camera for you.  (Oh -- and the rechargeable battery that lasts forever and charges quickly is such a bonus!  No more buying batteries!)

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy A. Eccles "Tim"
Reviews.Content: Did not want to lug the Pentax K-7 DSLR to China on a business trip.  Read lots of reviews and decided on the Lumix.  Best Buy had the FH-22 (Touch Screen version) of this camera on sale, but when I went to local BB I found that they do not carry these in store.  So decided to compare BB online to Amazon.  Found the FH-20 on Amazon to be much cheaper than the FH-22 at BB and main complaint I read about FH-22 was Touch Screen not being user friendly.  Decided to save money and get FH-20 from Amazon and have no regrets at all.  Camera starts up fast and takes very good pictures.  There is a large variety of shooting modes to choose from, so you can get a decent shot in almost any condition.  It is small, easy to carry and easy to use.  Bought Wasabi Power Batter & Charger Kit to have spare batteries and travel charger.  Battery life is good, but not fantastic - pretty much the same as any other point & shoot I have owned (Sony, Nikon, Pentax).  The only problem we had with this camera was one time when my wife changed the battery she bumped the SDHC card loose and got a write error.  We reseated the card and had no problems after.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point & shoot with superb zoom
Reviews.Author: John Eakins
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera for what it is: point & shoot with exceptional zoom capabilities for under $200. Has so many features and choices that you must read at least some of manual to use any of them, but that's to be expected and takes only about an hour to get what you need. Should have a tripod for extreme zoom shots, as you would on any serious camera. Camera is small enough for a pocket or shirt pocket, but not too small to forget you have it. Quality at 14MB makes a great 16x20 picture for framing.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Danielle C. Peterson
Reviews.Content: I just decided to get this camera because my Canon Powershot was a few years old.  The zoom on this camera is amazing!  The only think I don't care for is that when it's in "Play" mode, you can't just start taking pictures like you can on a Canon.  You have to flip the switch back to "camera" mode.  Other than that, I love the camera!

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: barney
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for several weeks.  Have not had much opportunity to use it, but I have played around with it.  I have been using Intelligent Auto and find it takes good pictures and is so easy to use.  Since I am not a serious photographer, just a Grandma taking pix of the grandkids, this is the camera for me.  Purchase at a good price from Amazon.  I have owned Olympus FE-210 and fe cameras.  They were alkaline battery operated and both lasted just about a year.  The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 feels like a superior product.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for an on-the-go chick!
Reviews.Author: Mel Mac
Reviews.Content: As a person always on the go, this is the perfect sized camera to carry around in my coat pocket, bag or clipped (in its case) to my jeans. I took this camera with me when I visited the San Diego Zoo and Wild Animal Park. It has great quality, and the battery life is awesome (especially considering how often I use it). I'm thankful that it has a rechargeable battery otherwise I would be spending an arm and a leg on batteries!

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera before a trip out to Jackson Hole as I wanted something that would fit in my pocket while skiing and still take great photos. It worked great, even in the frigid temperatures with no problems affecting the battery life. I used it every day while there and took hundreds of photos and some videos.The download and reviewing of photos is very simple too, and the picture quality is great.There is still alot more to learn about this camera to get the maximum use from it, but I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: purse camera
Reviews.Author: F. Flor
Reviews.Content: We already own a Panasonic Lumix super zoom camera and love it. My wife asked for a small camera to carry in her purse. Although not the smallest of the mini cameras, I choose the FH20 for a couple of reasons;8X zoom is best in class, intelligent auto works wonderfully; large buttons are easy to use. It was out Christmas morning with the grandchildren for 5 hours. At least 100 photos were taken and the battery would have lasted for 100 more. It's hard not to get a good picture.

Reviews.Title: I love this little camera! (And it's red!)
Reviews.Author: C. V. Isaac "Scrap and Knit"
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this camera. The battery charged very quickly so I was able to take pictures immediately. I was also able to see the pictures that I took much more easily. It is very user friendly and easy to figure out how to take pictures quickly. (I am somewhat technically challenged.) I would recommend this camera to anyone. I am very satisfied with my purchase...and it's red!

Reviews.Title: Buy this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Holmes
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. After my Canon point and shoot suddenly stopped working, I had to buy a camera quick! I did some quick research, and even went to a photo store to ask for advice, but something kept drawing me back to this camera. Eventually I just decided to buy it, and I am extremely happy about my decision. It works great! The pictures it takes are beautiful, and such high quality. Both my brother and sister, who use SLRs, are impressed with the picture quality. Landscapes shots are beautiful! And you can also capture things moving quickly. I was at Glacier National Park and a herd of Big Horned Sheep ran across the path, and I was able to capture them! I have an extremely shaky hand, and this takes the clearest pictures. And close ups with Macro zoom are incredible. I had fun taking pictures of flowers, praying mantis, and my vegetable garden. And the flash doesn't wash out everything when pictures are taken inside.Movies are good also. You cannot zoom in once you are in movie mood, but who wants digital zoom anyway?! Just be aware of software problems, because I have not been able to upload my movies yet.My one complaint is that it is not compatible with a MAC. So, I repeat...CANNOT BE USED WITH APPLE COMPUTERS!!!! I tried plugging it in, and it just can't read it.But overall, I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera But...
Reviews.Author: Dr. Matt
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews and this camera came out on top or at least in the top three.  I mainly bought it for my wife who needs something totally uncomplicated, point and shoot.  When I received it, I played with it and it took fantastic pictures and was extremely happy.  I gave it to my wife for Christmas and she could actually work it well do to the IA feature that sets everything.  Really fantastic.  Problem with it is that in certain indoor pictures with the flash, the pictures have a really yellow tinge.  I've tried all kinds of things to fix it.  I change settings, the Auto White Balance, using the IA, NOT using the IA.  Thing is, sometimes it will take a good picture with great tones, I immediately take another picture with the EXACT same settings and the picture comes out yellow.  The best luck I've had is just not to use the flash.  It takes great low light pictures but then you have to change settings to turn the auto flash off and my wife won't/can't do it.  She'll take a flash picture with our old Cannon 35mm camera and the tones are way better.  So pretty much, it seems I bought myself this camera.  I called their customer service.  At least I did get a real person... half way around the world who could barely understand English let alone speak it.  He then started to READ the manual to me.  That was helpful.In defense of the camera, the particular room that we are trying to shoot the pictures in has fluorescent lamps at a 35 kelvin color range which is the "warm" look AND the ceiling is aged pine and the floors are a tan color.  I haven't noticed this yellowed picture problem in my office where I took indoor pictures with the flash.  I have halogen bulbs in some of the fixtures and 41K fluorescent lamps.I'm disappointed that my wife doesn't like my gift I gave her but I would still recommend this camera to most anyone and would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Gretchen Montgomery "avid reader"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera rather quickly after my Kodak Easyshare V1253 died. I had googled "best point and shot camera 2010" and this was what came up in the search. I read several reviews and the price was right so I bought it. I am sooo glad I did! The camera is very user-friendly and takes wonderful pictures. The flash seems intelligent enough to adjust as needed for various lighting conditions, the shutter speed is fast enough for what I do, and the battery life is great! I have no regrets on buying this camera. I am very pleased with the quality of my photos, much more so than with my previous camera. And I also love that it came with everything I needed (cords, charger, battery, etc.). I like that the charger has outlet prongs that flip down flat for easy storage in luggage or a purse (I don't have to worry about the prongs snapping off in my suitcase). Not to mention that I LOVE the red color! I would reccommend this camera to anyone who wants easy to use, pocket-sized camera that also takes amazing photographs.

Reviews.Title: From a happy photographer
Reviews.Author: James Church
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived early, and is just the right size and color. It has many features we haven't seen in competitive cameras in that price range. Easy to hold and use. It's just what my wife wanted.

Reviews.Title: Seems ok
Reviews.Author: Typing mom
Reviews.Content: I've had Sony and Kodak, haven't been too impressed with them, so tried this. Looked through a ton of cameras before I got this one, with all the great reviews I thought it would take pictures like an SLR or something, but this one doesn't seem to be anything spectacular, just the average digital camera, good enough though. Clear pictures. Alot of settings which I have yet to see a purpose for, but then again haven't had it long and only used it indoors. Wish I could use regular batteries in it, the charge on the battery with it doesn't seem to last very long.

Reviews.Title: Wow what a GREAT camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Ann Scott "Jingles"
Reviews.Content: WOW I love this camera!  I normally prefer to go to a camera store and buy one but this came highly recommended by a friend whose opinion I trust.  I was not disappointed!  This is a fabulous little camera.  I just came back from a month in Europe where I worked the poor little thing hard and it worked beautifully, never let me down.  Also before I left I went to a camera store to get a memory card & case for it, the guy took one look at it and said "oh, that's such a great little camera"...boy is he right.  I highly recommend this camera but do not recommend getting the memory card, it didn't arrive, shipping costs 1/2 of what the card costs and that's just dumb.  I went middle of the road on customer support because I haven't had to make use of that.

Reviews.Title: Easiest camera to operate ever!
Reviews.Author: J. Zegarelli
Reviews.Content: I found this camera to be so much easier to operate than my 4 year old Olympus. It was a piece of cake to figure out. Only downfall was I kept pressing my thumb on the buttons when handling the camera to take a picture. Have to get used to it. I haven't taken too many pictures and am looking forward to using the camera a lot more. The zoom is great and the recording was fantastic. Couldn't believe I could take the videos with such ease. Only bad thing I could say is "no zoom on video recording". Sound was great. Battery lasted and the suggestion from another reviewer to buy the Class 6 card worked out great. Great buy for the money!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: mary donegan
Reviews.Content: Just bought this camera before my trip to Turkey.  Easy instructions...love the on screen menu. Great picture quality.. 8x zoom enough for my kind of photography. Good price.  I still would prefer camera with view finder. However, not too much sunshine during my trip....so picture easy to see on the LED screen......Great shots of raindrops.  Red color of camera. made it easy to find in my carry on bag, in my hotel room,etc

Reviews.Title: Loveit!
Reviews.Author: Jim Squire
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and I love the red color. Takes very good pictures and I love the image stabalization.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for every type of picture, good value.
Reviews.Author: James P. Malone "SwimJim504"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera before our wedding/honeymoon. Have used it since then for different types of events. All of the pictures turn out great. Lots of good shooting modes, so you will always have the right shot for any situation. HD video is a cool feature. Keep in mind those files are HUGE, so be careful if you do not have a large memory card. In all, very happy with the camera thus far. Definitely good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: carole kornsweig
Reviews.Content: Takes decent pictures for its price...telephoto is limited. Suits my purposes for now.  Perhaps if I learned to use the manual features I could get better quality pictures.  Great for close to medium shots.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Transaction
Reviews.Author: ddes
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  Reviews really helped in making my selection.  Purchase and receipt of item was excellent.  Perfect transaction.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional camera
Reviews.Author: joep
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a cruise we were taking to Alaska. Loved the image stabilization. The cruise ship did encounter some mild wave action, but the pics I took even as the ship was rocking were exceptionally crisp. It does take some time to get to know this camera, especially settings for different scenes, but overall takes great shots. Only weak area seems to be the fact that there is no optical viewfinder. At times that makes it difficult snapping a quick shot.

Reviews.Title: Right camera at the right price
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: I have always been a Canon fan when it comes to digital photography, having owned two digicams and one Canon camcorder.  I still think Canons are great, but when it came to buying an everyday point-and-shoot I took another look.  I wanted to get the most camera I could, including memory, for $200.  I was looking for 12+ megapixels, more than 4x optical zoom, HD video, and a quality lens.The Panasonic was the only product that came in well under $200.  It handles well, shoots quickly, and is so easy to use my 9-year old son had it figured out in about an hour.One thing that amazed me about the optics is the macro capability.  My son took a photo of a Lego Clone Trooper with the lens less than one inch from the subject, and it came out perfectly in focus.  So add macro along with the zoom and wide angle capabilities of this excellent product.  I could not be more satisfied with it!

Reviews.Title: Love the features
Reviews.Author: Jacine
Reviews.Content: When researching cameras I read hundreds of reviews and criticisms of the major brands. I had been using one of the first Panasonic digital cameras out on the market. It took many hours of reviewing to come up with a camera which I felt would meet my needs. I have not been disappointed in the DMC-FH20. I feel as if I can control the shots with the variety of settings without all the fuss of a DSLR since I take hundreds of shots at a time. The macro setting is fabulous as is the setting for night scenery. The battery life is less than my previous Panasonic but I realize the upgrades require more "juice" so I will be purchasing another battery or two to accommodate my needs.

Reviews.Title: Everything we wanted..and Windows 7
Reviews.Author: J. Brown
Reviews.Content: We've only had the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 camera a few days.  It certainly seems to be everything we wanted.  We were replacing an older digital camera, and the size, weight, and abilites of this Panasonic amazed us.  Very small, but beautiful pictures.  Before buying, we had emailed Panasonic asking if the software included would run on the Windows 7 operating system.  Their answer the same day was that it would..but in "compatibility mode". However, we discovered when we downloaded the software that it runs perfectly on our Windows 7 with no adjustments, and Windows 7 is listed in the booklets as one of the OS suggested for use.  We also ordered the suggested 4gb memory card, and case.  While all the items arrived separately, we got everything within 5 days. Amazon did its usual great job.  R & J Brown  Texas

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: tybu
Reviews.Content: This is a great litttle camera for the price.Battery life is very long, pics have turned out great and night shots are not as bad as some people reported. The ai does a very good job by itself. great camera for the price, and great for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: Point-and-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Blanco
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Panasonic DMC-FH20 camera recently after reading many positive reviews. I needed a small digital camera for an upcoming European vacation and wanted something simple to learn to operate. The only misgiving I had upon receiving the camera was that the software enclosed with the camera was not supported by my computer operating program. (I have XP SP1 and the software requires XP SP2 or SP3.) I am not too concerned by this however, as I use Adobe Photoshop and just bring my photos into Photoshop from Explorer or My Computer. The camera does seem to be as advertised and seems simple to operate. The Intelligent (Ia) setting does its job and I have already taken some sharp, clear pictures with the camera. I like it!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: I. K. Larson "Rosefili"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this purchase.  So many functions in such a small packageI still haven't learned all of them, but the sharpness and clarity of the photos are so  much better than my previous camera.  I am glad I listened to Consumer Report and customers' reviews.  I used to work with several camera bodies and tons of lenses.I loved all the options they gave me.  But, they certainly didn't fit in a purse or pocket.  I am having so much fun looking for pictures again...Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (red)

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, dicey customer support, but execs who care
Reviews.Author: GrapeApe
Reviews.Content: This past Xmas I decided to surprise my wife with a new digital camera--one that shot faster, had a better zoom, and was truly pocket-sized.  My first impulse was a Canon, but the reviews indicated that the "improved" models had problems not there in previous models.  I read reviews for Nikon's model, but all the reviews I read indicated that the Lumix DMC-FH20 by Panasonic had the others beat in every way, and cost less to boot.  Amazon had the best price by far, so I ordered the camera, a case, and two backup batteries and charger from Wasabi.  The camera is great.  I'm not the family picture taker, but I know all shots are easy to take for my wife, the picture quality is incredible, and it shots so much faster than the Kodak digital we bought 5 years ago that I've never regreted my purchase.UNTIL YESTERDAY.  While camping recently my wife read an onscreen message that the battery power was gone.  I put in the Wasabi backup battery, a simple task, and she was good to go.  We recharged the spent Panasonic battery when we got home, and I put the Wasabi in the charger and the Panasonic back into the camera.  A message came across the screen: "No Battery Power Remains."  Put it back into the charger, but the light was instantly green, indicating a fully charged battery.  Reinserted the battery and got the same message, and the battery icon showed no life in the battery.  Put the Wasabi back in, and the camera works great once more.  Clearly the battery is not really recharged or it is sending an incorrect message to the camera.  In either case the battery is not functioning after just one use--admittedly a very long use from Xmas 2010 until June of 2011 on a single charge.  Called Amazon, but kind of suspected I needed to be calling Panasonic support.  Amazon, in its usual polite and helpful manner, gave me a number and confirmed that the time since purchase took it out of their hands.  My call to Panasonic support was cold and fairly brief.  Support explained that the battery had a 90 day warranty only, and the fact that it was malfunctioning after just one charge didn't enter into the picture.  There were absolutely no contingencies, though I vowed to the support tech that despite numerous Panasonic products in my home and in my history (I'm 63), I would never buy another Panasonic product again if going over his head with a letter got me no further than my conversation with him.I wrote an explanatory letter to Joseph Taylor who, to the best of my google searching ability is the chairman and CEO of Panasonic, and found there seems to be no way to find an address for Mr. Taylor's office.  I sent it to Panasonic's North American headquarters in Seacaucus, NJ and hoped for the best.  I was amazed to read a string of horridly critical letters on a Panasonic website about their lack of satisfactory customer support, and many vows to never buy again worded much more crudely than mine!  If Mr. Taylor or someone above the status of the support tech, agrees that a Panasonic rechargeable battery ought to last more than a single charge and agrees to replace it at their cost instead of mine, I will be happy to amend this review.  Until that happens, I am very disappointed in the manner in which Panasonic backs up their expensive and highly advertised products--and I will make good on my vow until the day I die!ADDITION:  Got two phone calls from Panasonic apologizing for the overzealous techie who told me I would have to buy a new battery myself.  My letter to Mr. Taylor got a response in less than a weak and the aforementioned caller promised to send me a new battery in 5 to 7 days.  My faith in Panasonic's good name has been restored!  I only wish the lower level employee had referred me to a supervisor to have saved all this trouble.

Reviews.Title: Software supplied with camera
Reviews.Author: A. Mccarthy
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera as a Christmas gift and my wife has not used it yet, but I tried to install the software on 2 PC's both running windows xp. All went well until I tried to open the programs, they crashed and indicated the app must close. (I used the debug button which did nothing) (Windows event viewer indicated the app had created a net runtime error)I sent a note to Panasonic as I was not going to use the softare until Christmas. They sent a note back with the Help Desk Phone nuumber. I called them and they said unstall and reinstall the software. I did this and had the same problem, I checked with Microsoft to insure I had the latest updates which I did. Called again the next day and the person suggested I uninstall and reinstall the software. I explained I did this once before and he did not offer any help. His answer it must be your PC's Then suggested I create folders and just drag the pictures onto the PC. If you are not going to fully support the software why offer it! I hope the Camera works better than the software, I will find out in a few days after Christmas

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Rita Martinez "mo0nangel"
Reviews.Content: Ok This camera I've only had for a few weeks, but so far i am very very satisfied with the product. The camera is fairly easy to use, has tons of features that honestly I know I wont be using often but THE best feature it has is the intelligent Automatic button and function. That's pretty much all I use, but until I get the hang of the other functions. What truly convinced me that this camera was great was when I used the zoom to take a picture of a moth standing on a leaf of a palm tree three feet away from the window and finding out that not only did the image not blurr out but the iA (Intelligent Automatic) could simultaneously focus a macro image from 3 feet away...I don't know how to describe it except with the very same picture I took as evidence.I have not tried the video feature just yet, so this review will definitely be updated in the future. Like I said I've only had it for a few weeks. The battery life so far so good, I have only charged it once and have used it for three different events and it's still alive.Pros:- iA (intelligent automatic)- Image stabilizer works great- Good battery life- Small and sleek and lightCons:- In low light images sometimes turn out a bit pixelated

Reviews.Title: Great camera, 'till it broke
Reviews.Author: Larrygcmt
Reviews.Content: I bought the DMC-FH20 to replace my DMC-ZS3 which was stolen after 6 months.I really like the picture quality of both these cameras though they do take a little getting used to. The auto focus works well and once you start playing around with the custom features you can get some great pics in low light andother demanding circumstances. Both cameras had good zoom and took excellent video.I just did'nt have either camera long enough to really get to know it.After somescumbag relieved me of both my camera and video camera (both with irreplaceable pics of my Dad and kids) I bought the FH-20. I would havebought another ZS3 but i did'nt want to spend $500+ on cameras in under a year.Anyway the FH-20 was great for 5 months until I went to use it one night and the lens would not open. This seems to be a re-occuring issue for these machines. Sorry but I think consumer electronics should not break in the honeymoon period. Now I have to send it back to Texas and had no camera for the holidays. I never dropped it or abused it in any way. Unacceptable.
